meanings.definition: To transfer allegiance or property rights to another.
meanings.sent1: The knight had to attorn his loyalty to the new king.
meanings.sent2: After the treaty, the land was attorned to the neighboring kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to attorn its nut collection to the wise old owl.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she had to attorn her heart to the charming stranger.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ritual required the villagers to attorn their spirits to the sacred tree.

meanings.definition: To acknowledge a new landlord or owner.
meanings.sent1: The tenant had to attorn to the new landlord's rules.
meanings.sent2: When the property was sold, the tenants had to attorn to the new owner.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to attorn to the friendly neighbor as its new owner.
meanings.sent4: The old house seemed to attorn to the memories of its previous owners.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact seemed to attorn to the museum curator's care.
